result.execSummary:
The defendant John McMahon Shipp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

02:11 PM Defendant, John McMahon Shipp, appeared by phone. Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video.  Agent Marissa Fredrickson appeared by phone. All parties appeared by using  Zoom. Agent stated defendant will be discharged in Dec. with financial obligations due. DOC requested a civil judgment if Court will approve. Defendant stated he mailed the payment on Wed. State held no position. Court authorized a civil judgment for any outstanding balance upon discharge from probation. 2:15 PM

records.addlTxt: Letter from DCC-Cashier's Office seeking clarification of the DNA surcharges; letter reviewed by Judge Voigt with no action taken

ADDRESS INFO for John McMahon Shipp
Current: 531 E Tomlinson Street, Poynette, WI 53955 United States  (Effective: 02-01-2016)
Prior: N6262 Packard Dr, Pardeeville, WI 53954
filed by Attorney Ryan Frank
filed by Attorney Ryan Frank

Cases called: 14CT352, 14CT353, 14FO793, 15CF78, 15CF122, 15CF123, 15CF199, 15CT27, 15CF424, 15TR3178, 15TR3179, 15TR3180, 15TR3181, Defendant John McMahon Shipp in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 4,5,6 in 15CF122, counts 6,7,8 in 15CF199 and count 1 in 15CT27.
Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence on 15CT27: 37 days jail starting Jan. 4, 2016 at 7 p.m. Huber granted under jail rules. $1,568 fine, 60 days or payment plan. $65 blood draw fee. 16 mo. driver license revocation, 16 mo. IID. Complete AODA and follow treatment recommendations. (no jail credit). In 15CF199, 9 months jail on ct. 6, Consecutive to 15CT27. Huber granted under jail rules. Electronic monitoring granted. $443 costs. On cts. 7&8, 3 yr. probation. Absolute sobriety at all times. Complete AODA and follow treatment recommendations.  $243 costs on each count. DNA sample be submitted. (3 days jail credit on count 5). In 15CF122, 3 years probation on each count, $443, $243, $243 costs. Complete AODA and follow treatment recommendations. Absolute sobriety at all times. DNA sample be submitted. (1 day jail credit) 
All other criminal counts and cases read in and dismissed. Traffic and ordinance cases dismissed.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-06-2015 01:00 pm

Defendant John McMahon Shipp in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Frank requesting new return date, Atty Kohlwey requesting separate plea/sentencing time, Counsel to scheduled w/JA

Defendant John McMahon Shipp in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  15CF199, 15CF123, 15CF78, 14FO793, 14CT352, 15CT27, 15CF122, & 14CT353.  Defendant has a case in Dane Cty that is going to be settled on next week.  The outcome of that case will affect these cases in Columbia Cty.  Atty Frank requested a new return date.  Bond remains.  Court advised Atty Frank if there is going to be a plea, he needs to set these cases for a separate time not during returns due to volume of charges.  State had no objection to new return date.  Return date scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
